title: How many square feet is 60 feet? - Quora

response.answer_text: You can not convert a measure of length into a measure of area. However, if you meant to say what is the area of a square that has a perimeter of 60 feet, the solution is as follows: P = 4l l = 60/4 = 15 A = l^2 = 15^2 = 225 feet squared

The question seems does not justified as square feet is the measure of area.It is a two dimensional measure. The foot is the measure of unit length or a one dimensional measurement As such there are no square feet in 60 foot. Or simply 60 feet can not be converted into square feet
